snippet: The weekly claims for first-time unemployment benefits returned to pre-Hurricane Sandy levels, encouraging some analysts.
abstract: Labor Department reports that applications for weekly unemployment benefits dropped 25,000 to a seasonally adjusted 370,000, as a temporary spike caused by Hurricane Sandy fades.
lead_paragraph: The weekly claims for first-time unemployment benefits returned to pre-Hurricane Sandy levels, encouraging some analysts.

headline.seo: Jobless Claims Drop as Storm’s Effects Fade
headline.main: After Spike From Storm, New Jobless Claims Drop
headline.print_headline: After Spike From Storm, New Jobless Claims Drop
